I work primarily in Python so I was pleased to see two implementations
on G=
oogle Code.

NEAT-python (http://code.google.com/p/neat-python/) appears to=
 be the
more mature of the two* and I've seen at least one of the maintaine=
rs
posting here which is also encouraging.

To the maintainers:

- How comp=
lete is your NEAT implementation?
- What tasks/bugs are still outstanding?
=

I'm willing to put some time into this but at the moment the 'issues'
sect=
ion on the project doesn't seem to be enabled so it's not clear
what is cur=
rently being worked on.

Assuming the algorithm implementation itself is mo=
stly done I'd also
be very interested in working on a GUI to aid with visua=
lisation.

A more general question: which NEAT implementation is generally
=
considered to be the best to compare to when it comes to publications?
In o=
rder to compile Ken Stanley's reference C++ implementation I need
to make a=
 number of changes to satisfy the version of g++ that I have
here which con=
cerns me as I may introduce mistakes in doing so.

My aim with the python i=
mplementation would be to bring it to a level
where it can be readily consi=
dered as suitable for use in comparisons
in research; any thoughts on this?=


* The other being pyneat http://code.google.com/p/pyneat/
